UnitDefinition.Name: Target level type
UnitDefinition.Description: Accepted units whether a dose is assumed to be an internal, external or systemic dose. Controlled terminology.

Unit.Name: External dose
Unit.Description: The administered or external dose, often referred to as exposure or intake.

Unit.Name: Internal dose
Unit.Description: The absorbed dose is the amount of chemical that is systemically available and can be regarded as the fraction of the external dose that is absorbed and enters the general circulation.

Unit.Name: Internal (target) concentration
Unit.Description: Internal dose or target dose (tissue dose) is the amount of chemical present in a specific target of interest, i.c. a concentration.
